title: Reddit
cleaned_text: to HealthyGamerGG's subreddit! Post about mental health, lifestyle, spirituality, or other adjacent topics for community discussion. This is a serious issue that must be discussed. It's extremely unethical for a physician to recommend placebo treatments like homeopathy. Does that perhaps put doubt on his other recommendations? And I'm talking about things like that time he recommended to some dude he should eat beans because the dude was part of some fire type in that indian 3 types thing whose name I can't remember. That was nuts lmao. Anyway, I think this warrants discussion in this subreddit? What do you think? Proof he has promoted Ayurveda for those people that
